issues.title: Missing Specific Legal Authority and Powers Statement
issues.description: California Education Code requires school boards to have explicit statements of their legal authority and powers. While the policy mentions general authorization under Ed Code 35160, it lacks comprehensive coverage of the board's specific legal powers and duties as mandated by state law.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of a school district shall have the powers and duties prescribed by law and the powers and duties necessary to carry out the purposes for which school districts are established.

issues.required_language: The Board shall exercise the powers and perform the duties prescribed by law, including but not limited to those powers and duties set forth in Education Code sections 35010 et seq., and shall have all powers necessary to carry out the purposes for which school districts are established.

issues.title: Missing Brown Act Compliance Statement
issues.description: School boards must acknowledge their obligation to comply with the Ralph M. Brown Act regarding open meetings. This is a fundamental legal requirement for all public agency governing bodies in California.

legal_citations.text: In enacting this chapter, the Legislature finds and declares that the public commissions, boards and councils and the other public agencies in this State exist to aid in the conduct of the people's business. It is the intent of the law that their actions be taken openly and that their deliberations be conducted openly.

issues.required_language: The Board shall conduct all meetings in accordance with the Ralph M. Brown Act (Government Code sections 54950-54963) to ensure transparency and public access to the Board's deliberations and decision-making processes.

issues.title: Missing Conflict of Interest and Ethics Requirements
issues.description: Board members are subject to specific conflict of interest laws and ethical requirements under the Political Reform Act. The policy should acknowledge these legal obligations.

legal_citations.text: No public official at any level of state or local government shall make, participate in making or in any way attempt to use his official position to influence a governmental decision in which he knows or has reason to know he has a financial interest.

issues.required_language: Board members shall comply with all applicable conflict of interest laws, including the Political Reform Act (Government Code sections 81000 et seq.), and shall file required statements of economic interests as prescribed by law.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Fiduciary Duty
issues.description: While not explicitly required by statute, California courts have recognized that school board members have fiduciary duties to the district and students. Including this concept strengthens the policy's foundation.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of a school district shall have the powers and duties prescribed by law and the powers and duties necessary to carry out the purposes for which school districts are established.

issues.required_language: Board members recognize their fiduciary duty to act in the best interests of the district and all students, exercising their authority with care, loyalty, and good faith.

issues.title: Outdated Policy Date
issues.description: The policy was last updated in 2009, which is over 14 years ago. While not a legal compliance issue per se, regular policy review and updates are considered best practice for governance.

legal_citations.text: On or before December 31 of each year, the governing board of each school district shall review all of the policies adopted by the governing board and make such revisions as may be necessary.

issues.required_language: This policy should be reviewed and updated to reflect current legal requirements and best practices in school governance.
